subject: linear_algebra
statementHtml:
Solve the system of linear equations
\[ \begin{align*} x + 2y - z &= 3 \\ 4x - y + 5z &= 7 \\ 3x + y - 2z &= 1 \end{align*} \] in matrix form.",
hints: Check if the system is consistent or inconsistent
Try to find a solution by inspection (if possible)
Use row operations to transform the augmented matrix
solutionHtml:
First, we can use row operations to transform the augmented matrix:


\[ \begin{align*} 1 & 0 & -2 & 3 \\ 0 & 1 & 4 & 7 \\ 3 & 1 & -5 & 1 \end{align*} \]

Next, we can solve for the variables:


x = 1, y = 2, z = 1",

subject: linear_algebra
statementHtml:
Solve the system of linear equations
\[x + 2y - z = 1\]
\[3x - y + 4z = 7\]
\[x - 3y + 2z = -2\] in matrix form.",
hints: Start by writing the augmented matrix A|b
Use row operations to transform A into upper triangular form
The solution is now easily read from the right-hand side
solutionHtml:
To solve this system, we first write it in matrix form:


\[A|b = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & -1 \\ 3 & -1 & 4 \\ 1 & -3 & 2 \end{bmatrix} | \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 7 \\ -2 \end{bmatrix}\]

We then apply row operations to transform A into upper triangular form:


\[R_1 \rightarrow R_1 + 3R_2, R_2 \rightarrow R_2 - 9R_1\]
\[\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & -1 \\ 0 & -13 & 11 \\ 1 & -3 & 2 \end{bmatrix} | \begin{bmatrix} 4 \\ 7 \\ -2 \end{bmatrix}\]

The solution is now easily read from the right-hand side:


\[x = 0, y = 1, z = 1\]",

solutionHtml:
To solve this system, we can use matrix operations:

\[A^{-1}A\mathbf{x} = A^{-1}\mathbf{b}\]

\[\mathbf{x} = (A^{-1}A)^{-1}(A^{-1}\mathbf{b})\]

problem.statementHtml: Solve the system of linear equations represented by the matrix equation \[A\mathbf{x} = \mathbf{b}\], where A is a 2x3 matrix and b is a 2-element vector.
hints: Check if any rows or columns of A are zero.
Try to find the free variable(s) in the system.
Use back-substitution to find the value of x.
problem.solutionHtml:
To solve this system, we can use row operations to transform A into upper triangular form.

  • Swap rows 1 and 2: \[\begin{bmatrix}0 & 1 & -2 \ 1 & 0 & 3 \end{bmatrix}\]
  • Eliminate the second row:
    • \[x_1 + 2x_2 = 4\]
    • \[x_2 = 2\]
  • Solve for x_1: \[x_1 = 0\]
